intro: Ridolfia segetum, commonly known as the field ridolfia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and is often found in disturbed soils and fields. Ridolfia segetum is primarily a weed in agricultural settings but has some medicinal uses in traditional herbal medicine.
